mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Hay, Eliza Kortright Monroe, 1786-1840
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Your letter shows you are under the influence of a great misapprehension as to the cause and course of my feelings as indicated in my letters to Hortensia. Husband's health has been very delicate. Go to Washington to see Dr. Hunt. I certainly will come to my child, my only child and as you say, "at a moment when she will most require the care of her Mother." Uncertain of the date when she should come.
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Eliza Kortright Monroe Hay to son-in-law Lloyd N. Rogers., 8 April 1830
